Title:
Morphological and molecular identification of a new species
of Fulvoderma (Hymenochaetaceae, Basidiomycota) from the Yunnan-Guizhou
Plateau, China
Keywords:
Hymenochaetales; taxonomy; wood-rotting fungi; Yunnan
province
Abstract:
A new wood-inhabiting fungal species, Fulvoderma
yunnanense spp. nov., is proposed based on a combination of
morphological features and molecular characters. Fulvoderma yunnanense
is characterized by annual, laterally stipitate basidiomata with greyish
brown pore surface, a monomitic hyphal system with simple septate
generative hyphae, tubular cystidia and broad ellipsoid to subglobose,
thin-walled, smooth basidiospores measuring as 4.05.4 ×3.34.8 µm.
Sequences of ITS and nLSU rRNA gene regions of the specimens were
generated and phylogenetic analyses were carried out with methods of
maximum parsimony, maximum likelihood and Bayesian inference. The
phylogenetic analyses inferred from ITS+nLSU indicated that Fulvoderma
yunnanense nested in Fulvoderma within Hymenochaetaceae. Further study
within Fulvoderma on the basis of ITS dataset revealed that it formed a
monophyletic lineage with a strong support and then grouped with F.
australe.
